benchmark_details.name: ReaMOT Challenge
benchmark_details.overview: The ReaMOT Challenge is designed to advance the research on Reasoning-based Multi-Object Tracking (ReaMOT) and evaluate the modelsâ€™ reasoning capabilities. It includes 1,156 language instructions with reasoning characteristics, 423,359 image-language pairs, and 869 diverse scenes, categorized into three levels of reasoning difficulty: Easy, Medium, and Hard.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To advance research in reasoning-based multi-object tracking and evaluate models' reasoning capabilities.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The analysis of the ReaMOT Challenge dataset is not sufficiently comprehensive.

data.source: Constructed from 12 datasets including Argoverse-HD, DanceTrack, GMOT-40, KITTI, MOT17, MOT20, MPHOI, PathTrack, PoseTrack, SportsMOT, UA-DETRAC, and UAVDT.
data.annotation: Manual annotation combined with GPT-assisted annotation.

methods: Evaluation using new tailored metrics for the ReaMOT task.
methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated using a combination of language instructions' reasoning scores.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better performance in reasoning-based multi-object tracking.
methodology.baseline_results: ReaTrack achieves state-of-the-art performance on the ReaMOT Challenge benchmark.
methodology.validation: Extensive experiments demonstrate the effectiveness of the ReaTrack framework.
